options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: It is a branched tricyclic glycosylated nonribosomal peptide

questions.explanation:
Solution:

Effective against Pseudomonas

Highyeild:

Vancomycin is a branched tricyclic glycosylated peptide with bactericidal activity against most organisms and a bacteriostatic effect on enterococci. At a site different from that of penicillins and cephalosporins, vancomycin binds tightly to the D-alanyl-D-alanine portion of cell wall precursors, thereby interfering with bacterial cell wall synthesis. This leads to the activation of bacterial autolysins that destroy the cell wall by lysis. Vancomycin may also alter the permeability of bacterial cytoplasmic membranes and may selectively inhibit RNA synthesis. vancomycin is effective against several gram-positive organisms including methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA). Common side effects include pain in the area of injection and sometimes allergic reactions.

questions.text: A 33-year-old female is suffering from Diarrhoea. She was on 3rd generation cephalosporin a few weeks ago. CT scan of the abdomen is given. What is the drug of choice for this condition?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Oral Vancomycin Oral Vancomycin is an antibiotic used in the treatment of severe bacterial infections in hospitalized patients. It is effective against infections of the respiratory tract (e.g. pneumonia), urinary tract, skin and soft tissues, bones and joints, heart, blood, and others.

Highyeild:

The diagnosis of this clinical vignette is Pseudomembranous colitis. inflammation of the large intestine (colon) due to an overgrowth of Clostridioides difficile (C difficile) bacteria. This infection is a common cause of diarrhoea after antibiotic use. In the CT scan, we can see the accordion sign. Oral Vancomycin and metronidazole both are effective, But a better drug is oral Vancomycin.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A . Oral metronidazole is an antibiotic medicine that helps your body fight infections caused by bacteria and parasites. It is used to treat infections of the liver, stomach, intestines, vagina, brain, heart, lungs, bones and skin. Option: C. Clindamycin is an antibiotic medication used for the treatment of a number of bacterial infections, including osteomyelitis (bone) or joint infections, pelvic inflammatory disease, strep throat, pneumonia, acute otitis media (middle ear infections), and endocarditis. Option: D . Cefazolin i s an antibiotic medicine used to treat bacterial infections in your body. It is effective in infections of the lungs (eg. pneumonia), ear, urinary tract, skin and soft tissues, bones and joints, blood, and heart. It is also used to prevent infections during surgery.

Extraedge:

Vancomycin Tricyclic glycopeptide - Streptomyces orientalis Inhibits synthesis of cell wall phospholipids and prevents cross-linking of peptidoglycans at an earlier step than B-lactams. Active against gram positive bacteria, highly resistant Strep. pneumo, Clostridia, Enterococcus, Staph. epi and MRSA Synergy with aminoglycosides. Used in treatment of MRSA and highly resistant Strep. species.

questions.text: Identify the given syndrome which was caused after taking vancomycin :
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Red man syndrome

Highyeild:

Red man syndrome (RMS) is an anaphylactoid reaction caused by the rapid infusion of the glycopeptide antibiotic vancomycin. RMS consists of a pruritic, erythematous rash to the face, neck, and upper torso, which may also involve the extremities to a lesser degree.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. Toxic epidermal necrolysis (TEN) is a rare and serious skin condition. Often, it's caused by an adverse reaction to medication like anticonvulsants or antibiotics like lamotrigine, carbamazepine, allopurinol, Sulfonamide antibiotics, nevirapine, etc. Option: B. Fixed drug eruption (FDE) is a distinctive type of cutaneous drug reaction that characteristically recurs in the same locations upon Reexposure to the offending drug. Option: C . Erythema multiforme is a skin immune reaction that an infection or medication can trigger. Its name combines the Latin “erythema” (redness), “multi” (many), and “forme” (shapes) and describes the main symptom, which is a rash on the body where each mark resembles a bullseye.

questions.text: A 37-year-old man has a fever, malaise, headache, and severe abdominal pain. Rebound tenderness is present. Diagnosis of peritonitis is made and the patient is shifted to the operation theatre. After the surgery, he was shifted to the surgery ward. There he acquired an MRSA infection. What is the drug of choice for a given infection ?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Vancomycin

Highyeild:

Vancomycin is the drug of choice for MRSA. Staphylococcus aureus is one of the “ESKAPE pathogens”, considered to require urgent development of new therapies, in spite of some decline in the incidence of methicillin-resistant S. aureus (MRSA) infections. Vancomycin, a Glycopeptide with an excellent spectrum of activity against Gram-positive pathogens through inhibition of cell wall synthesis, has been the mainstay of treatment for MRSA. No other drug has shown superiority to vancomycin in the treatment of MRSA infections with the possible exception of linezolid in hospital-acquired pneumonia (HAP).

questions.text: Burkholderia cepacia is intrinsically resistant to:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Polymyxin B Polymyxin B is an antibiotic used to treat meningitis, pneumonia, sepsis, and urinary tract infections. While it is useful for many Gram-negative infections, it is not useful for Gram-positive infections. It can be given by injection into a vein, muscle, or cerebrospinal fluid.

Highyeild:

Clinical uses of Polymyxins Only polymyxins B and E are used clinically; the others damage the kidneys. Polymyxin B can also cause kidney damage and therefore can only be applied topically to treat infections such as those of the eye, ear, skin, and urinary bladder. Polymyxin E, also known as colistin, is used frequently for diarrhea in children. The chief therapeutic use of the polymyxins is treating infections of gram-negative bacteria that are resistant to penicillin and other broad-spectrum antibiotics. Burkholderia cepacia is intrinsically resistant to Polymyxin B Aminoglycosides do not have activity against anaerobes, S. maltophilia, or Burkholderia Cepaci A.baumannii and Burkholderia species are resistant to fosfomycin
